---
title: Upper bounds on policy loss
---

Consider a candidate value function $\tilde V \colon \ALPHABET S \to \reals$ which is approximately optimal, i.e., 
$$
  \| V^* - \tilde V \|_{∞} \le α.
$$
Let $π_{\tilde V}$ be _a greedy policy_ with respect to $\tilde V$, i.e.,
$$
  π_{\tilde V}(s) \in \arg \min_{a \in \ALPHABET A} 
  \Bigl[ c(s,a) + γ \sum_{s' \in \ALPHABET S} P(s'|s,a) \tilde V(s')
  \Bigr].
$$
We are interested in bounding the loss in performance when using policy $π_{\tilde V}$ instead of the optimal policy, i.e., 
$\| V^* - V^{π_{\tilde V}}\|_{∞}$. We call this **the policy loss**.

:::{#thm-policy-loss}
$$
\| V^* - V^{π_{\tilde V}}\|_{∞} 
\le
\frac{2 γ}{1-γ} \| V^* - \tilde V\|_{∞}.
$$
:::
